III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth's behavior, chronological and developmental age,
1

size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth's
treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation When a certain youth needs to be restrained, a particular staff
member conducts excessive restraints on this youth. There are
concerns that the staff member is intending to hurt the youth as
the youth's arm was bent more than needed and the staff member
provokes the youth. In mid-December 2024, the youth had bruises
on their chin that were caused by the staff member. The youth
was crying and told the staff member he was being hurt. This
same staff member has also asked unknown youth to sit on the
staff member’s lap.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on February 5,
2025. Complainant reported “getting a vibe from Staff 1” during
Legacy in November and not liking Staff 1. Complainant was
asked to describe the vibe and was not able to provide specific
statements made by Staff 1, actions or events. Complainant
denied seeing any youth sit on Staff 1’s lap but stated during
Legacy in November Complainant overheard two youth talking
about sitting on Staff 1’s lap. Complainant reported not knowing if
the youth resided at the facility but thought they must have as they
were youth at Legacy. Complainant stated the only thing heard as
the two youth walked by was they had sat on Staff 1’s lap.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
February 6, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A
reported he has been restrained by staff at the facility. Youth A
stated he did not think he had any concerns with any of the
restraints he has been in with any staff member but could not
remember. Youth A described being restrained by Staff 1 “weeks
ago.” Youth A reported he did not think he was hurt in any
restraint. Youth A stated he had a bruise on his left jaw (currently
no bruising) in the past. Youth A reported he could not remember
how he got the bruise. Youth A stated he could not remember if
the bruise was from being in a restraint. Youth A reported he had
concerns about Staff 1. Youth A stated he could not remember
what his concerns were regarding Staff 1. Youth A denied having
any concerns with how staff restrain youth. Youth A was asked by
DHHS Worker if he really could not remember or if he just did not
want to talk about his [Youth A’s] concerns. Youth A stated he
could not remember. Youth A stated he did not think Staff 1 has
hurt any youth in a restraint.
2

Youth A denied seeing any youth sit in Staff 1’s lap. Youth A
stated he was never told by any youth they sat in Staff 1’s lap.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
February 6, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth B
described Staff 1 as working at the school and being a staff that
“enforces the rules.” Youth B denied ever seeing Staff 1 hurt any
youth during a restraint or at any other time. Youth B stated he
has not heard any of the youth say Staff 1 hurt them. Youth B
denied ever seeing Youth A have a bruise on Youth A’s face or
chin area.
Nurse was interviewed face to face at the facility on February
6, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Nurse denied
ever seeing or treating Youth A for bruising on the face. Nurse
reported Youth A has not indicated any concerns with staff after
being in a restraint.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on February
6, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 stated he
could not recall any restraints with Youth A in the month of
December. Staff 1 reported he has not been in many restraints
with Youth A. Staff 1 stated he was in a restraint with Youth A
sometime in January. Staff 1 denied ever causing or seeing a
bruise on Youth A’s face or chin. Staff 1 reported he has never
used more force on any youth when in a restraint or bent their
arms back to hurt the youth. Staff 1 described being an Aegis
instructor and is always paying attention to the correct angles and
position in a restraint.
Staff 1 denied ever having any youth sit on his lap. Staff 1
reported he does attend Legacy. Staff 1 stated he has never
asked a youth to sit on his lap and never would ask a youth to sit
in his lap.
Director of Residential Services and Vice President of
Treatment were interviewed face to face at the facility on
February 6, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. They
both denied Staff 1 having any restraints with Youth A in the
month of December. They both described Staff 1 as having a no-
nonsense approach and denied having concerns with how Staff 1
does restraints.
3

Director of Residential Services and Vice President of Treatment
both denied ever seeing any youth sit in Staff 1’s lap. They both
described Staff 1 as never sitting down and being on the move.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
February 12, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker who
joined via Teams. Supervisor reported he has never seen Staff 1
restrain Youth A. Supervisor denied Youth A or any other youth
ever expressing any concerns to him about Staff 1. Supervisor
stated he does not recall Youth A having a bruise on the face.
Supervisor stated he has never seen any youth sit in Staff 1 lap.
Supervisor denied any youth telling him youth were sitting in Staff
1’s lap.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on
February 12, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker who
joined via Teams. Therapist reported Youth A has not mentioned
any concerns to her about Staff 1. Therapist stated Youth A has
not talked about being hurt or injured in a restraint. Therapist
denied seeing any bruise on Youth A’s face or chin.
Therapist stated she has never seen any youth sit in Staff 1’s lap.
Therapist denied any youth telling her Staff 1 asked them to sit in
his [Staff 1] lap or that they did sit in Staff 1’s lap.
DHHS Worker had no finding in the investigation.
Video Review
Video footage of Youth A being restrained by Staff 1 on 2/05/2025
was reviewed. The restraint took place in the classroom by Staff 1
and Principal. Youth A throws a desk chair, a water bottle and
punches Staff 1. Principal places Youth A in a restraint and is
assisted by Staff 1. Youth A is seen fighting the restraint, trying to
kick Principal and Staff 1. The restraint transitions to a one-
person safety position by Principal with Staff 1 bridging Youth A’s
feet.
Video footage of Youth A being restrained by Staff 1 on 1/07/2025
is no longer available to review.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident Report 20418024 incident date 01/07/25 of a
restraint by Staff 1 on Youth A. No injuries were noted or
documentation of Youth A being in pain or injured. The
restraint lasted three minutes.
4

• Incident Report 207220241 incident date 02/05/25 of a
restraint by Staff 1 on Youth A. No injuries were noted or
documentation of Youth A being in pain or injured. The
restraint lasted five minutes.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 1 completed the required Aegis training on
10/17/2024.
• Therapeutic Holds Policy. Policy states, “Only those
techniques taught during Aegis training are permitted.
These include the Voluntary Escort, Level One, Level Two,
Level Three, Level 4, the Benevolent Restraint, and the
Aegis Safety Position. “Pain compliance” or the use of
pressure points to induce pain or discomfort, are strictly
forbidden and will result in immediate disciplinary action, up
to termination of employment.”
• Staff Code of Conduct Policy. Policy states, “At all times,
staff shall treat residents and coworkers with respect and
dignity in words and actions. All staff will strive to be
professional in the behavior, conversation and all
interactions with others.”
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews and video review of one of the two restraints of Youth A
by Staff 1, Staff 1 used proper techniques when restraining Youth
A. There was no documentation of Staff 1 restraining Youth A in
December. There was no documentation of Youth A having any
bruise on his chin.
Interviews with staff and youth denied seeing any youth sit in Staff
1’s lap. None of the staff or youth interviewed reported hearing
any youth state they sat in Staff 1’s lap.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
